options.text: intense insolation of a land surface in the area of a col or weak low.
lifting action at a cold front at night.

advection of warm air over a relatively cold sea or land surface.

variant.question: What is true about thunderstorms?

options.text: They can exceptionally occur at a warm front, when the warm air is conditional unstable.
They occur only in the summertime.
They only occur, when a cold front occlusion is present.
They occur at cold fronts only.

variant.question: Frontal thunderstorms are triggered off by

options.text: rising air due to falling pressure at air mass boundaries.
convection by intense daytime heating or cold air moving over a warm surface.
mass ascent over large areas or cold air moving over a Warm surface.
rising air due to falling pressure or due to orographic uplift.

variant.question: In the initial stage of a thunderstorm, which of the following is true?

options.text: Both up-currents and down-currents are present.

variant.question: On a significant weather chart the thunderstorm symbol signifies

options.text: moderate / severe turbulence and moderate / severe icing.
